show.title: In Search of Soil
show.summary: Exploring the mysteries of soil in search of answers that you can use in your garden or on your farm.  Each week features scientists and experts sharing insights into topics like soil science, composting, cover cropping, biochar, no-till, and fungi, among other things!   In Search of Soil is hosted and produced by Diego Footer.

title: Francesco Tortorici - Biochar | In Search of Soil #11
subtitle: Francesco Tortorici - Biochar | In Search of Soil #11
summary:
In this episode of In Search of Soil, we have biochar scientist and citizen scientist advocate Francesco Tortorici to fill in those knowledge gaps and encourage you to push forward with being a responsible citizen scientist.

Francesco Tortorici is an engineer by trade, and since 2014, he has worked with the Port Townsend designing and building biochar filters that remove heavy metals from stormwater runoffs. He and his wife Joan founded Olympic Biochar in 2015 with the goals of promoting biochar and its benefits and providing good, locally-made biochar.

Learn about Francesco Tortorici - https://www.olympicbiochar.com/
